page.title: 03EDUCATION
page.content: The{education system}in Jersey differs from that of the United Kingdom. The States of Jersey run 23 primary schools for the ages 5-11,and 4 secondary schools catering for 11-16 year olds. At the age of 14 children have an option of transferring to Hautlieu school (14-18 year olds) for "O" and "A" levels. There is also a college of adult and further education (Highlands) which provides vocational training. The 2 Colleges, Victoria and The Jersey College for Girls are direct grant public schools and a further 5 private schools, including 2 RC secondary schools, are grant aided. Within this block are several schools: 2 primary, 2 secondary, Hautlieu, Highlands and St Michaels (a private school).
